content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 14 Mar 2019What is retained earnings?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Sandra TeoLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 14 Mar 2019Retained earnings are profits less dividends and other distributions paid to investors. Retained earnings are mostly impacted by changes in the net income and dividends. A more detailed retained earnings formula is RE = Begining Period Retained Earnings + Net income/loss - Cash Dividends - Stock Dividends.0 comments0
